p.k: Charlie Ottley travels through time from Colombia's pre-Hispanic origins through its colonial era to the present day, encapsulated by the bustle of the country's cosmopolitan capital Bogota. Starting at the mystical ruins of San Agustin, Charlie ventures through towns and landscapes rich in cultural history like the perfectly preserved colonial town of Villa de Leyva. Back on the road, he visits a terracotta house, an underground cathedral, some striking sculptures and the country's most famous restaurant.
